image.altText: A smartphone with an Airbnb logo on it in front of the same logo being projected on a screen.

props.synopsis: From July 1 short-term rental accommodation bookings of less than 28 days, made on booking services like Airbnb and Stayz, will pay a five per cent levy in the ACT.

title.children: Canberra short-term rental booking levy to 'level the playing field'

image.altText: sofronoff

props.synopsis: A legal bid to skewer corruption findings against retired judge Walter Sofronoff argues he could not be held in contempt of his own inquiry.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann prosecution inquiry chair defends contact with journalists

image.altText: A headshot of Viveca Moodie wearing a blue shirt and standing inside a library, in front of bookshelves

props.synopsis: Unplanned staff absences are being blamed for several closures of libraries in the ACT this year, leaving some library users concerned.

title.children: Viveca loves her local library, but was surprised to find the doors shut

image.altText: Detective Sargeant Chris Watson

props.synopsis: For the first time, the lead police investigator on the case is speaking about how they found those responsible for the death of Glenn Walewicz.

title.children: 'Not deserving of this': Glenn Walewicz police investigator speaks for the first time

image.altText: Sign for the Australian National University (ANU) in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's "America First" agenda hits Australian universities, with at least six reporting funding cuts or pauses under the new administration.

title.children: Trump uni questionnaire 'verges on foreign interference', Go8 leader says

image.altText: A sign on the front of a building saying 'Genius Childcare', photographed through bars.

props.synopsis: Administrators have taken control of the majority of childcare centres run by teetering empire Genius.

title.children: Administrators take control over most of national childcare chain's centres

image.altText: A concrete sign that reads "Campbell Primary School.

props.synopsis: A court battle between the former head of the ACT's education directorate and the ACT's corruption watchdog ends with the ACT Supreme Court ordering no costs for either side.

title.children: No costs awarded in former education boss's legal battle with corruption watchdog

image.altText: A young man with brown hair stands in front of a white wall with some scaffolding attached, holding plans for a deck

props.synopsis: Construction workers are calling on the ACT government to speed up the approval process for development applications amid an ongoing housing crisis.

title.children: Waiting months for approval for a deck, tradies say change is needed

image.altText: A chrome coloured crushed ute abandoned on the street in Port Vila's town centre.

props.synopsis: Vanuatu is one of the most disaster-prone nations on the planet, with cyclones, earthquakes and volcanic eruptions. And its people now face an unsettling question: how many disasters can one nation take?

title.children: Vanuatu's capital is a ghost town — some say it might be 'finished'

image.altText: Bunch of white, oval medication tablets and white medication capsules.

props.synopsis: America's pharmaceutical giants have been plotting to torpedo Australia's Pharmaceuticals Benefits Scheme, despite securing major concessions 20 years ago.

title.children: Why big US pharma hates Australia and has for decades

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a desk holding a black folder open with yellow-gold curtains and two flags behind him.

props.synopsis: Silicon Valley, whose top executives have cultivated close relationships with Donald Trump, is now pushing him to pressure Australia to relax its regulations or risk retaliation.

title.children: Tech titans ask Trump to take up fight against Australian regulation

image.altText: Logo Open AI is in white on black phone screen in front of a white computer screen with words.

props.synopsis: Digital rights group Noyb says the chatbot generated inaccurate personal data, violating EU privacy rules.

title.children: OpenAI faces complaint after ChatGPT 'hallucinated' man murdered his sons

image.altText: donald trump and a school child hold up signed executive orders

props.synopsis: The order would leave school policy almost entirely in the hands of states and local boards, a prospect that alarms many within the US education system.

title.children: Trump signs order aimed at dismantling US Department of Education

image.altText: young baby wrapped in a blanket after being pulled from rubble in gaza

props.synopsis: After hearing cries of a baby from underneath concrete rubble in Khan Younis, rescuers dig down to find the infant alive.

title.children: Baby rescued from rubble after air strike in Gaza killed her family

image.altText: A row of cybertrucks

props.synopsis: US regulators have recalled 46,000 Cybertrucks in the latest in a series of call-backs for the controversial pick-up truck.

title.children: Cybertrucks are being recalled in the US. Will they ever hit Australian roads?

image.altText: Graffiti tagged on the side of a building with police tape in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Police allege the man targeted two homes, a Jewish school and a shopping centre with antisemitic graffiti.

title.children: 41yo accused of spraying 'vile' graffiti on Sydney school and homes

image.altText: Peter Dutton is shown at a press conference. He's wearing glasses and a black suit with an Australian flag behind him.

props.synopsis: It's a weird time when your friends become almost as problematic as your potential enemies, but that's the situation we face.

title.children: Dutton says he could handle Trump, but can any Australian PM?

image.altText: A child whose face can't be seen sits on a small piece of climbing equipment in front of a coloured mat outdoors.

props.synopsis: A parliamentary inquiry has been called into the troubled childcare sector following a landmark ABC investigation into serious safety breaches in the industry.

title.children: Powerful parliamentary inquiry to scrutinise childcare sector after ABC investigation

image.altText: a female students at an exam table

props.synopsis: International students have been "thrown under the bus" and unfairly blamed for the rental crisis, according to new study.

title.children: 'Thrown under the bus': Study concludes international students not to blame for rising rents

image.altText: A man with long hair stands on a stage with a mic

props.synopsis: Plus White Lotus star Jason Isaacs wades into prosthetic penis discourse, protesters interrupt Gal Gadot's walk of fame ceremony and more.

title.children: Hollywood director arrested for allegedly swindling Netflix out of $17 million

image.altText: cactus close up

props.synopsis: Two poorly placed cacti more than 50 years ago have turned into a full-scale invasion. It's prompting calls for people to dispose of their cacti safely to avoid a very prickly problem.

title.children: Two pot plants left behind 60 years ago became a sprawling infestation

image.altText: Hundreds of Muslims outside Lakemba mosque, with the Palestinian flag flying on the front gate.

props.synopsis: NSW Police are investigating a threat made to a mosque in Padstow that references the Christchurch massacre a day after Lakemba Mosque received a similar threat.

title.children: Police investigation into TikTok comment uncovers threat to second mosque

image.altText: Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri in the pit garage in China, wearing caps and hoodies, looking at the track

props.synopsis: McLaren's drivers had mixed fortunes in Australia, but both have high ambitions ahead of this weekend's racing in China.

title.children: Piastri wants to attack, Norris calls for calm despite championship lead

image.altText: A man wearing a T-shirt crossing his arms in front of a bay with seaweed and cliffs

props.synopsis: Similar seawater quality problems to those that have been reported near Victor Harbor are threatening the livelihood of a fisher in the state's south-east.

title.children: SA fisher says 'burning' water harming marine life and business

image.altText: Usman Khawaja celebrates a Sheffield Shield century for Queensland.

props.synopsis: Australia opener Usman Khawaja rejects comments made by a leading Queensland Cricket official after he missed the Bulls' most recent Sheffield Shield match.

title.children: Khawaja hits back at 'inflammatory' Queensland Cricket claims

image.altText: Sunfish near Albany

props.synopsis: Rarely found in the Southern Ocean, a 2.5-metre sunfish washed up on WA's Lowlands Beach between Denmark and Albany could be a sign of a warm current moving south, a marine ecologist says.

title.children: Giant sunfish washes up on WA's southern coast

image.altText: photo being transformed into fat person

props.synopsis: The latest TikTok trend is an AI filter that shows people what they would look like if they were fat.

title.children: An AI fat-filter is trending on TikTok — here's why it can be harmful

image.altText: A man holds up a sign saying '10 years in limbo' with parliament house out of focus in the background

props.synopsis: A coalition of refugee and human rights groups writes to the leaders of Australia's largest political parties ahead of the federal election.

title.children: Don't demonise asylum seekers, human rights groups warn politicians

image.altText: Kirsty Coventry behind an IOC podium in Greece.

props.synopsis: Two-time gold medallist Kirsty Coventry becomes the International Olympic Committee's first female and African president in its 130-year history.

title.children: Zimbabwean Coventry elected as IOC's first female president

image.altText: Nishan Velupillay  celebrates a Socceroos goal against Indonesia.

props.synopsis: The Socceroos remain a work in progress, according to coach Tony Popopvic, after a posting a 5-1 win over Indonesia in their latest World Cup qualifier in Sydney.

title.children: Socceroos taking 'strides forward' towards securing World Cup qualification

image.altText: A green tent in a park. An empty black camping chair next to it.

props.synopsis: Not a single fine or move-on order has been issued to homeless people in Brisbane, one week after Brisbane City Council declared it would evict campers from its parks.

title.children: Not a single homeless person evicted by police after Brisbane mayor's threat

image.altText: WA Liberal Leader Libby Mettam steps down from her party’s leadership

props.synopsis: Libby Mettam is making way for the man who has been lurking behind her the whole time. Now the WA Liberals will be hoping she and Basil Zempilas can lean on each other if they form a leadership duo.

title.children: WA Liberal rebrand could see Basil Zempilas and Libby Mettam team up

image.altText: Person getting arrested with handcuffs

props.synopsis: Victorian bail reforms, including scrapping remand as a last resort for youth offenders, will become law after the legislation passed both houses of parliament in a sitting that stretched late into last night.

title.children: Legal groups slam new Vic bail laws as 'dangerous and discriminatory'

image.altText: A close up of Dichen Lachman in a medical chair in Severance.

props.synopsis: Australian Severance star Dichen Lachman, who plays Mark's wife Gemma, takes us behind the scenes as the epic 76-minute series finale, Cold Harbor, finally hits our screens.

title.children: Severance's Australian star would never go through the procedure

image.altText: The 'Roxy' sign at the top of the Roxy Theatre.

props.synopsis: Owners of the Roxy Theatre in Parramatta have threatened legal action against Sydney Metro for blocking the development of the near-century old building.

title.children: Owners of historic theatre threaten legal action against Sydney Metro
